column4: heelp! emergency! I can not boot ubuntu 9.10. something got wrong. How can I do it? pleaase...
I had a problem with sound, installing some packages, and then just...oooo, can not boot it. Any help?? pleaase
who is experiened in ubuntu? guys...
Did you install a new kernel?  if so, try one of the older ones at the GRUB menu - if you get no grub menu, try holding shift after the bios screen.
You need to hold it after the POST, when grub would load.  If you're not on Karmic, try pressing esc when it says "GRUB loading..." instead.
Try using the third option, if it's an older kernel.
Normal, but you should have more than one of each.  Ifnot, I'm not sure.
Use the second-latest one that's not a "recovery mode"
Hmm, interesting - I don't know much about graphics issues, you may be better off asking for general help again.
Hmm, something like "Having trouble booting <release>, getting low-graphics mode when using older kernel" where <release> is which version of Ubuntu you're using.  HTH and good luck!
If you want to revert to GDM, use "sudo dpkg-reconfigure gdm"
sudo apt-get -f install and/or "sudo dpkg --configure -a" should fix any broken packages, between tham.
The "sudo" bit makes it run as root; if you're already root you can drop "sudo" from the start.
Hmm, interesting... try "aptitude reinstall gdm" as root, then.
In that case, "aptitude install gdm" and see what it complains about.  It'll be a dependency problem.
